hints.content:
To find how long the $\blueE{\text{otter}}$ and $\maroonD{\text{alligator}}$ are together, we need to find the total.  So, we add.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/38a44acbedb9a026eedadbbace9bfd733b44508e)

$\blueE{39}\text{ inches}  + \maroonD{55}\text{ inches} =\purpleD{\square}\text{ inches}$

Let's add to find the total.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f5fb39e000ccca5c16c6a6fc838f39ef5a94e115)

$\blueE{39}\text{ inches}  + \maroonD{55}\text{ inches} =\purpleD{94}\text{ inches}$
The otter and alligator measure $\maroonD{94}\text{ in}$ combined.

question.content:
A zookeeper measured the lengths of different animals at the zoo.

Animal | Length  
- | - | -
Snake | $23 \text { inches}$ 
Lion | $60 \text { inches}$ 
Alligator |  $55 \text { inches}$ 
Otter |  $39 \text { inches}$ 

**How long are the otter and alligator combined?**  

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] $\text{inches}$
